etymology.description: Depicts a short‐tailed bird (e.g., a sparrow) -> also original form of 唯(唯) (wéi, "only") before evolution into 鷕(鷕) (yǎo, "cry of a bird")
etymology.interpretation: 隹(隹) (zhuī, "short-tailed bird") is a pictogram representing a bird with a short tail. Its depiction served as the foundation for other characters related to birds, such as 鷕(鷕) (yǎo, "cry of a bird").

examples.chinese: 这只短尾的隹在树林中飞翔(這只短尾的隹在樹林中飛翔)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhī duǎnwěi de zhuī zài shùlín zhōng fēixiáng.
examples.english: This short-tailed bird flies in the forest.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里展出了一件以隹为题材的古代绘画(博物館裡展出了一件以隹為題材的古代繪畫)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ zhǎnchūle yī jiàn yǐ zhuī wèi tícái de gǔdài huìhuà.
examples.english: The museum displays an ancient painting themed on the short-tailed bird.

examples.chinese: 远古诗篇中常用隹来象征自由(遠古詩篇中常用隹來象徵自由)，寓意生动(寓意生動)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎngǔ shīpiān zhōng cháng yòng zhuī lái xiàngzhēng zìyóu, yùyì shēngdòng.
examples.english: In ancient poems, the short-tailed bird is often used to symbolize freedom, conveying vivid meaning.
